timeline.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText: Or, you can just use one of the JAR files in test/resources/testdata. This idea does not require (unnecessary) network connections.
replies.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText:
This test definitely shouldn't pull an entire dependency tree to only look at one jar.
We could bundle it. I might yet do that if we need to contrive a specific jar with specific characteristic for testing. For now this one was small and simple enough that it could easily be characterized.
replies.author: elharo

replies.bodyText:
Truth-java-8-extension is small JAR file and thus a good case to observe the completeness of listing.
Apart from that, I found conscrypt-openjdk-uber-1.4.2.jar in test/resources/testdata has nice list of contents to assert.
suztomo-macbookpro44% jar tf dependencies/src/test/resources/testdata/conscrypt-openjdk-uber-1.4.2.jar
META-INF/MANIFEST.MF
META-INF/SIGNINGC.SF
META-INF/SIGNINGC.RSA
META-INF/
META-INF/native/
META-INF/native/libconscrypt_openjdk_jni-linux-x86_64.so
META-INF/native/conscrypt_openjdk_jni-windows-x86.dll
META-INF/native/libconscrypt_openjdk_jni-osx-x86_64.dylib
META-INF/native/conscrypt_openjdk_jni-windows-x86_64.dll
org/
org/conscrypt/
org/conscrypt/NativeCrypto.class
org/conscrypt/OpenSSLSignature$1.class
org/conscrypt/TrustManagerImpl$1.class
org/conscrypt/OpenSSLContextImpl$TLSv1.class
org/conscrypt/OpenSSLX509CertPath.class
org/conscrypt/OpenSSLECPrivateKey.class
org/conscrypt/OpenSSLCipherRSA$OAEP$SHA512.class
replies.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText:
That does have some nice inner classes and is not too large.
As to network connections in tests, yes, I am nervous about that. Though I do wonder, is this any different than pulling in our own dependencies from Maven central. In fact, this is a Maven dependency we're loading from the same serverlocal cache we'd load it from if we depended on it directly from pom.xml.
replies.author: elharo

timeline.bodyText: You may want to add some inner classes.
timeline.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText: Also verify there's no such class that has package name META-INF?
replies.author: suztomo
